A

applyCRC(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ANSI.CRC16ANSI
Applies CRC-16-ANSI to given command Command must contain PDU (function code and function value) and device address
applyCRC(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Applies CRC-16-ANSI to given command Command must contain PDU (function code and function value) and device address
applyLRC(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Applies ASCII LRC to given command Command must contain PDU (function code and function value) and device address

C

checkCRC(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ANSI.CRC16ANSI
Checks whether provided reply contains valid CRC
checkCRC(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Checks whether provided reply has valid length and contains valid CRC
checkLRC(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Checks whether provided ASCII reply contains valid LRC
checkReply(byte[], int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Checks provided device reply for errors: overall validity, exception codes and CRC/LRC errors
convertCommandToModbusType(byte[], int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
 
convertToASCII(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Converts given command to ModBus ASCII format Command must contain PDU (function code and function value) and device address
convertToTCP(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Adds MBAP Header to provided prepared command.
convertToTCPNoFixedLength(byte[]) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Adds MBAP Header to provided prepared command.
CRC16ANSI - Class in polylogic.org.protocols.ANSI
This class performs CRC16ANSI calculations and checks.

ModBus - Class in polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus
This library generates typical requests for Modbus protocol.

P

polylogic.org.protocols.ANSI - package polylogic.org.protocols.ANSI
 
polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus - package polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus
 
prepareRTU6ByteCommand(byte, byte, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Creates skeleton of simple 6-byte Modbus RTU command For example to read value of 3 coils starting from coil 2 in device with address 10 write: prepareRTU6ByteCommand(10,1,2,3); where 1 is read coil status modbus command

R

readValueOfCoils(byte, int, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Read coils values (Modbus function code: 1) For example to read value of 3 coils starting from coil 2 in device with address 10 in RTU format write: readValueOfCoils(10, 2, 3, TYPE_MODBUS_RTU);
readValueOfHoldingRegisters(byte, int, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Read values of holding registers (Modbus function code: 3) Note that holding register address is passed with offset of 40001 - so to point to holding register 40003 you need to point to address 40003-40001=2 To point to 40001 address you need to point to 0 address (zero offset).
readValueOfInputRegisters(byte, int, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Read values of input registers (Modbus function code: 4) Note that input register address is passed with offset of 30001 - so to point to register 30003 you need to point to address 30003-30001=2 To point to 30001 address you need to point to 0 address (zero offset).
readValueOfInputs(byte, int, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Read inputs values (Modbus function code: 2) Note that input address is passed with offset of 10001 - so to point to input 10003 you need to point to address 10003-10001=2 To point to 10001 address you need to point to 0 address (zero offset).
RESPONSE_Acknowledge - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Slave has accepted request and is processing it, but a long duration of time is required.
RESPONSE_CRC_ERROR - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
CRC in reply was faulty - probably data was broken on the way
RESPONSE_Gateway_Path_Unavailable - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Specialized for Modbus gateways.
RESPONSE_Gateway_Target_Device_Failed_to_Respond - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Specialized for Modbus gateways.
RESPONSE_Illegal_Data_Address - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Data address of some or all the required entities are not allowed or do not exist in slave
RESPONSE_Illegal_Data_Value - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Value is not accepted by slave
RESPONSE_Illegal_Function - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Function code received in the query is not recognized or allowed by slave
RESPONSE_Memory_Parity_Error - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Slave detected a parity error in memory.
RESPONSE_Negative_Acknowledge - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Slave cannot perform the programming functions.
RESPONSE_NO_DATA - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Reply don't have data at all or data in insufficient
RESPONSE_Slave_Device_Busy - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Slave is engaged in processing a long-duration command.
RESPONSE_Slave_Device_Failure - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Unrecoverable error occurred while slave was attempting to perform requested action

S

setTcpID(int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Basically this library carries one identificator and increases it with every call to convertToTCP (internally called in every command generator, when Modbus type is set to Modbus-TCP/UDP).
stripReplyToDATA(byte[], int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Strips device reply to data only, removing device address, function code, CRC and TCP/UDP or ASCII overhead.
stripReplyToPDU(byte[], int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Strips device reply to address + PDU, removing CRC and TCP/UDP or ASCII overhead.

T

tcpID - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Basically this library carries one identificator and increases it with every call to convertToTCP (internally called in every command generator, when Modbus type is set to Modbus-TCP/UDP).
TYPE_MODBUS_ASCII - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Modbus ASCII with LRC CRC
TYPE_MODBUS_OVER_TCP - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Modbus over TCP or Modbus over UDP Type with CRC-16-ANSI.
TYPE_MODBUS_RTU - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Modbus RTU Type with CRC-16-ANSI
TYPE_MODBUS_TCP_UDP - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Modbus TCP or Modbus UDP Type (TCP and UDP use the same ADU) without CRC in request.
TYPE_MODBUS_TCP_UDP_NO_FIXED_LENGTHS - Static variable in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Modbus TCP or Modbus UDP Type (TCP and UDP use the same ADU) without CRC in request and without REQUEST LENGTH field in functions, that have fixed-length answer.

W

writeValueOfMultipleCoils(byte, int, List<Integer>, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Writes values of multiple coils (Modbus function code: 15)
writeValueOfMultipleHoldingRegisters(byte, int, List<Integer>, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Writes values of multiple holding registers (Modbus function code: 16) Note that holding register address is passed with offset of 40001 - so to point to holding register 40003 you need to point to address 40003-40001=2 To point to 40001 address you need to point to 0 address (zero offset).
writeValueOfSingleCoil(byte, int, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Writes value of single coil (Modbus function code: 5) For example to write value 70 in coil 2 of device with address 10 in RTU format write: writeValueOfSingleCoil(10, 2, 70, TYPE_MODBUS_RTU);
writeValueOfSingleHoldingRegister(byte, int, int, int) - Static method in class polylogic.org.protocols.ModBus.ModBus
Writes value of single holding register (Modbus function code: 6) Note that holding register address is passed with offset of 40001 - so to point to holding register 40003 you need to point to address 40003-40001=2 To point to 40001 address you need to point to 0 address (zero offset).
